title: Jimmy Modeste
text:
Jimmy Modeste (born 8 July 1981 in <a href="Paris">Paris</a>, France) is a Cape Verdean former professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> who works as assistant <a href="Manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> at French <a href="Championnat%20National">third tier</a> <a href="Red%20Star%20F.C.">Red Star FC</a>, after having held the same position at amateur clubs <a href="L%27Entente%20SSG">L'Entente SSG</a> and <a href="Noisy-le-Grand%20FC">Noisy-le-Grand FC</a> simultaneously.
Coaching career.
In January 2019, the two clubs where Modeste held the assistant manager role both knocked out professional opposition in the ninth round of the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Coupe%20de%20France">Coupe de France</a> on consecutive days. <a href="L%27Entente%20SSG">L'Entente SSG</a> beat <a href="Ligue%201">Ligue 1</a> side <a href="Montpellier%20HSC">Montpellier HSC</a> on 5 January and <a href="Noisy-le-Grand%20FC">Noisy-le-Grand FC</a> beat <a href="Ligue%202">Ligue 2</a> side <a href="Gaz%C3%A9lec%20Ajaccio">Gazélec Ajaccio</a> on 6 January.
He followed ESSG manager Vincent Bordot to Red Star FC in the summer of 2019, keeping an assistant manager role.
